image.altText: An adult and a child walking across a pedestrian crossing in a school zone, with the bonnet of a car in the left foreground.

props.synopsis: Canberra mother Veronica Fortune says the road past her local school is an accident waiting to happen. She's written to MLAs about safety improvements and campaigned for adjustments to the roads, but so far nothing has changed.

title.children: Push to reduce ACT school zone speed limit to 30kph

image.altText: An adult and a child walking across a pedestrian crossing in a school zone, with the bonnet of a car in the left foreground.

props.synopsis: Canberra mother Veronica Fortune says the road past her local school is an accident waiting to happen. She's written to MLAs about safety improvements and campaigned for adjustments to the roads, but so far nothing has changed.

title.children: Push to reduce ACT school zone speed limit to 30kph

image.altText: Seven teenage boys stand in a circle on an outdoor basketball court listening to a man in a white beanie speaking.

props.synopsis: Menslink workshops are helping young men tackle harmful social expectations, loneliness and anger, by stirring up the toxicity "all around them" and encouraging them to decide what sort of men they want to be.

title.children: Confidential sessions challenging 'toxic' masculinity in teen boys

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Depraved and violent torture is how an ACT Supreme Court judge described the actions of a brother found guilty of sexually abusing his two sisters over several years, as he was sentenced to over 16 years in jail.

title.children: Canberra judge jails brother for 'depraved' abuse of sisters

image.altText: A rabbit outside Parliament House

props.synopsis: Rabbits were introduced to Australia during colonisation, with 'plagues' causing widespread environmental, agricultural and economic destruction. Nowadays the pest is controlled using biocontrol, but experts say without funding the population could soon be out of control.

title.children: The ACT could be looking down the burrow of a rabbit plague

image.altText: An aerial photograph of a spreading patch of fire in bushland, with masses of smoke rising from the fire.

props.synopsis: Five years on from the Orroral Valley fire some Bumbalong residents are still rebuilding. An apology in the findings of an inquiry into the fire yesterday was the first time the hardship of residents was officially acknowledged.

title.children: Though not scathing, the inquiry into this devastating fire was needed

image.altText: Large plumes of smoke rise from a forested mountain ridge during sunset.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the devastating Orroral Valley fire near Canberra in 2020 has found the crew of a Defence helicopter who accidentally started the blaze made an "error of judgement" in not notifying authorities of the fire.

title.children: Inquiry finds ADF crew made 'error' in not reporting Orroral Valley fire

image.altText: A mother holds a snowboard and a toddler who is smiling.

props.synopsis: Towns in the Snowy Mountains rely on tourist dollars during winter, but as the cost of living bites, Aussies are looking for ways to enjoy snow holidays on a budget.

title.children: How Aussies are affording a 'bloody expensive' trip to the snow

image.altText: Donald Trump points at someone with his right hand index finger.

props.synopsis: Key defence figures on both sides of the Atlantic warn the risks to AUKUS run deeper than whether a review finds it is "America first" enough for Donald Trump.

title.children: 'It's really stupid': Warnings Trump's treatment of allies risks more than AUKUS

image.altText: A man with facial hair wearing a high-vis vest.

props.synopsis: Chinese-owned company Landbridge has come out in defence of its operation of Darwin Port, as the federal government negotiates to get the facility back "under Australian control".

title.children: Could the US and China battle it out for control of this key Australian asset?

image.altText: Lando Norris walks from his wrecked F1 car

props.synopsis: Formula 1 championship rivals Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris have crashed at the Canadian Grand Prix. Follow live.

title.children: Piastri survives after rival Norris crashes into him in 'stupid' mistake

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: McLaren team princpal on the crash between his cars
Oscar Piastri refelcts on the late crash with Lando Norris
Lando Norris speaks to media, and apologises to his team

image.altText: Jim Rogers and his partner Tyler.

props.synopsis: There were signs for years that something was wrong, and Jim Rogers's doctor put it down to stress. But when the 55-year-old couldn't silence his phone, his world began to unravel.

title.children: The early signs of dementia that Jim missed for years

image.altText: Adam Scott stands undercover as rain falls at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain halts play with Adam Scott just one stroke off the lead on the eighth hole in the fourth round of the US Open. Follow live.

title.children: Rain pauses play in US Open final round as Scott battles for lead

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Play is paused as the rain hammers down
5th hole: Adam Scott moves into a share of the lead
4th hole: Scott celebrates early, but gets his first birdie of the day

image.altText: Virgin Australian and Qantas flights listed on an airport departures board

props.synopsis: Qantas, Air New Zealand and a rejuvenated Virgin Australia are putting the pieces into play for what is shaping up to be a torrid summer of competition, that could see travellers come out on top and investors pay the price.

title.children: Travellers to win, investors to pay as airlines prepare for price war

image.altText: Energy tower with blue skies and fencing

props.synopsis: Australians struggling to pay their energy bills face 'major inconsistencies' in how retailers respond, a survey of financial counsellors has found. The energy sector is lagging behind banking and water when it comes to supporting customers in hardship.

title.children: Energy consumers facing financial hardship are being left in the dark

image.altText: As treet covered in water up to the headlights of cars. On the other side a tow truck.

props.synopsis: The latest advice to engineers and policy makers warns storms will increase in intensity and frequency depending on how quickly the world warms.

title.children: 'Very few flood maps' account for the risk of climate change, expert warns

image.altText: A woman with short hair and a blue shirt looks ahead.

props.synopsis: With more than 100,000 treatment cycles taking place yearly in Australia's growing IVF industry, those with first-hand experience say it's time for changes to increase transparency and simplify regulations.

title.children: As demand for IVF treatment grows, some say 'flat-out busy' labs need closer attention

image.altText: Man standing in Bali shop with drinks in the background.

props.synopsis: The community of a small Balinese village is reeling after a brutal attack on Saturday killed one Melbourne man and seriously injured another.

title.children: Bali community reels after fatal villa shooting

image.altText: Harry Grant of the Queensland Maroons is seen posing for a photograph

props.synopsis: Harry Grant insists he can make it work as a State of Origin starting hooker, despite Queensland losing all four games he has begun on the field and not the bench.

title.children: Grant not concerned with horror Origin starting stat

image.altText: Gloved hand holding a flask of golden liquid fuel inside a lab facility.

props.synopsis: It's tricky to decarbonise airplanes, but a plan to manufacture aviation fuel from canola looks set to take off.

title.children: Farmers could help decarbonise planes with fuel made from canola

image.altText: trump and melania

props.synopsis: Thousands gathered in Washington for the parade celebrating the 250th anniversary of the US Army, which coincided with President Donald Trump's 79th birthday.

title.children: 'We're the hottest country in the world': Trump's parade rolls through DC

image.altText: The silhouette of a soldier is seen firing a machine run at sunset

props.synopsis: Ukraine receives the bodies of another 1,200 Ukrainian soldiers killed in the war with Russia, as part of agreements to exchange both prisoners of war and the dead, Ukrainian officials say.

title.children: Russia hands over 1,200 soldiers' bodies to Ukraine

image.altText: police in camouflage search a suburban area

props.synopsis: The man who allegedly assassinated a US state politician and attempted to kill a state senator had a list of dozens of different targets in his car, police say.

title.children: Minnesota assassin had list of 70 potential targets, police say

image.altText: Clear plastic containers stacked together each carrying something that appears light brown in colour.

props.synopsis: Fiji watched closely as witnesses in the nation's largest-ever drugs trial gave evidence revealing the alleged details of a meth operation.

title.children: Alleged drug cartels and superyachts: Inside Fiji's largest-ever drugs trial

image.altText: Music lovers enjoying chamber music and indigenous performances in Townsville.

props.synopsis: The largest chamber music festival in the southern hemisphere has made a shock decision to change locations in 2026.

title.children: World-renowned chamber music festival moving north

image.altText: Young children jump on circles and crosses lit up on the ground

props.synopsis: A decision to make smaller scale, immersive shows has helped Patch Theatre make profound impacts on Australian kids.

title.children: A change in direction has brought immersive theatre to children

image.altText: Australia's Steve Smith reacts in pain as he leaves the field

props.synopsis: Steve Smith will almost certainly be ruled out of Australia's first Test against West Indies, starting in Barbados on June 25.

title.children: Steve Smith focusing on 'good result' after avoiding surgery

image.altText: Dylan Voller, ex Don Dale Youth Detention centre detainee rapping at Dark Mofo's Winter Feast 2025-06-05 10:06:00

props.synopsis: Best known for his treatment as a child at Don Dale youth detention centre, Dylan Voller is trying to heal from his past by using music and songwriting.

title.children: Dylan Voller is using music to heal from his past

image.altText: Oscar Allen is tended to by a West Coast trainer

props.synopsis: West Coast co-captain Oscar Allen is helped off the ground by two trainers after collapsing behind the play during the fourth quarter of the 34-point loss to Carlton.

title.children: Eagles 'hopeful' Allen has avoided serious injury after collapse in loss to Carlton

image.altText: Toby Sexton and Lachlan Galvin run

props.synopsis: The Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs held on to beat the South Sydney Rabbitohs 24-18 on a wild Sunday night NRL clash at the Olympic stadium, that featured a 30-minute lightning delay.

title.children: Bulldogs survive storm delay and brilliant Bunnies fightback to claim victory

image.altText: A landscape showing steep rock formations rising up out of hilly bushland.

props.synopsis: When Hyun Park slipped while climbing in the Warrumbungles, her life depended on her 80-year-old mentor and the tactical gymnastics of a 20-hour overnight rescue mission.

title.children: Remarkable 20-hour rescue of climber dangling unconscious 200m up a cliff

image.altText: Photo of All Are Welcome bakery window with a building reflected in the glass.

props.synopsis: The ABC reported in recent days staff at the three inner-Melbourne All Are Welcome bakeries were owed $243,000 in superannuation and $125,000 in leave entitlements.

title.children: Popular bakeries close their doors with staff owed super, leave

image.altText: A security camera in the foreground with a house behind it

props.synopsis: With crime rates a big concern for many Australians, households are increasingly turning to technology to try to protect against thieves.

title.children: Do home security cameras deter thieves?

image.altText: nsw police officers examine a reserve in werrington after a body was found

props.synopsis: Police officers went to Irwin Street in Werrington on Sunday after a passer-by spotted the body in a remote part of the reserve and called triple-0.

title.children: Woman's body found in Sydney reserve had been there 'for a period of time'

image.altText: A truck unloading rubbish at Woodlawn landfill.

props.synopsis: Energy from waste is common around the world, and there are almost a dozen plants now in operation or being proposed across Australia — but with the opportunity comes other problems.

title.children: As Australia embraces energy from waste, perceptions are changing
